paragraphs.content: The burden of the desert of the sea. As whirlwinds in the south pass through; so it cometh from the desert, from a terrible land.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The burden of the desert of the sea. As whirlwinds in the south pass through; so it cometh from the desert, from a terrible land.

paragraphs.content: A grievous vision is declared unto me; the treacherous dealer dealeth treacherously, and the spoiler spoileth. Go up, O Elam: besiege, O Media; all the sighing thereof have I made to cease.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A grievous vision is declared unto me; the treacherous dealer dealeth treacherously, and the spoiler spoileth. Go up, O Elam: besiege, O Media; all the sighing thereof have I made to cease.

paragraphs.content: Therefore are my loins filled with pain: pangs have taken hold upon me, as the pangs of a woman that travaileth: I was bowed down at the hearing of it; I was dismayed at the seeing of it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Therefore are my loins filled with pain: pangs have taken hold upon me, as the pangs of a woman that travaileth: I was bowed down at the hearing of it; I was dismayed at the seeing of it.

paragraphs.content: My heart panted, fearfulness affrighted me: the night of my pleasure hath he turned into fear unto me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My heart panted, fearfulness affrighted me: the night of my pleasure hath he turned into fear unto me.

paragraphs.content: Prepare the table, watch in the watchtower, eat, drink: arise, ye princes, and anoint the shield.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Prepare the table, watch in the watchtower, eat, drink: arise, ye princes, and anoint the shield.

paragraphs.content: For thus hath the Lord said unto me, Go, set a watchman, let him declare what he seeth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For thus hath the Lord said unto me, Go, set a watchman, let him declare what he seeth.

paragraphs.content: And he saw a chariot with a couple of horsemen, a chariot of asses, and a chariot of camels; and he hearkened diligently with much heed:
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he saw a chariot with a couple of horsemen, a chariot of asses, and a chariot of camels; and he hearkened diligently with much heed:

paragraphs.content: And he cried, A lion: My lord, I stand continually upon the watchtower in the daytime, and I am set in my ward whole nights:
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he cried, A lion: My lord, I stand continually upon the watchtower in the daytime, and I am set in my ward whole nights:

paragraphs.content: And, behold, here cometh a chariot of men, with a couple of horsemen. And he answered and said, Babylon is fallen, is fallen; and all the graven images of her gods he hath broken unto the ground.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And, behold, here cometh a chariot of men, with a couple of horsemen. And he answered and said, Babylon is fallen, is fallen; and all the graven images of her gods he hath broken unto the ground.

paragraphs.content: O my threshing, and the corn of my floor: that which I have heard of the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, have I declared unto you.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O my threshing, and the corn of my floor: that which I have heard of the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, have I declared unto you.

paragraphs.content: ¶ The burden of Dumah. He calleth to me out of Seir, Watchman, what of the night? Watchman, what of the night?
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ The burden of Dumah. He calleth to me out of Seir, Watchman, what of the night? Watchman, what of the night?

paragraphs.content: The watchman said, The morning cometh, and also the night: if ye will inquire, inquire ye: return, come.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The watchman said, The morning cometh, and also the night: if ye will inquire, inquire ye: return, come.

paragraphs.content: ¶ The burden upon Arabia. In the forest in Arabia shall ye lodge, O ye travelling companies of Dedanim.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ The burden upon Arabia. In the forest in Arabia shall ye lodge, O ye travelling companies of Dedanim.

paragraphs.content: The inhabitants of the land of Tema brought water to him that was thirsty, they prevented with their bread him that fled.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The inhabitants of the land of Tema brought water to him that was thirsty, they prevented with their bread him that fled.

paragraphs.content: For they fled from the swords, from the drawn sword, and from the bent bow, and from the grievousness of war.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For they fled from the swords, from the drawn sword, and from the bent bow, and from the grievousness of war.

paragraphs.content: For thus hath the Lord said unto me, Within a year, according to the years of an hireling, and all the glory of Kedar shall fail:
paragraphs.contentHtml: For thus hath the Lord said unto me, Within a year, according to the years of an hireling, and all the glory of Kedar shall fail:

paragraphs.content: And the residue of the number of archers, the mighty men of the children of Kedar, shall be diminished: for the LORD God of Israel hath spoken it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And the residue of the number of archers, the mighty men of the children of Kedar, shall be diminished: for the Lord God of Israel hath spoken it.
